properties.Name: DividendOptionType
properties.Description:
Policyowners are normally permitted to utilize dividends in one of five manners:

Ex.:
-  Cash
-  Apply Against Premium Payments
-  Accumulate At Interest
-  Buy Paid-In Additions
-  Purchase One Year Term Insurance
-  Cash

where:

Cash:
Dividends are normally paid on policy anniversary dates.   Dividend checks are received after the company approves a dividend.

Apply Against Premium Payments:
Dividends can be applied directly to the policyowners premium payments, which lowers the premium expenses of the policyowner.

Accumulate Interest:
Dividends can be allowed to accumulate interest for withdrawal at any other time.  Policy dividends are not taxable but any interest paid on them is taxable income in the year that the interest is credited to the policy, whether or not it is actually received by the policyowner.

Buy Paid-In Additions:
Dividends can be used to purchase paid-up additions of life insurance of the same kind as the original policy.   The premium rate is based on the attained age of the insured at the time the paid-up additions are purchased.

Purchase One-Year Term Insurance:
Dividends can be used to purchase as much one-year term insurance as possible or to purchase one-year term insurance equal to the base policy's cash value.   This allows for any excess dividend portions to be applied under any of the regular options.

Columns.Name: DividendOptionTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Dividend Option Type.

Columns.Name: DividendOptionTypeName
Columns.Description: The name of a Dividend Option Type.

Columns.Name: DividendOptionTypeDescription
Columns.Description: The description of a Dividend Option Type.
